title: Augusta County: Alex Rives to Alexander H. H. Stuart, November 20, 1860
summary: Rives responds to letter from Stuart and reports a "vague fear" in his area after Lincoln's election. Rives proposes that Virginia confer with "other states" about the crisis and discusses the issue of Lincoln's cabinet appointments.
keywords: National Government, State Government, Secession, Unionism, American Civil War
